feed.title: Astraeus | Blog
feed.subtitle: Write ups for vaious ctf sites like HackTheBox, TryHackMe, and CyberSecLabs

entry.title: TryHackMe Tomghost
entry.summary: Nmap results As we can see ports 22, 53, 8009, 8080 are open Port 8080 is a default Tomcat instance. Running Gobuster on this port didn’t yield anything. Let’s look into port 8009 What is AJP? The Apache JServ Protocol (AJP) is a binary protocol that can proxy inbound requests from a web server through to an application server that sits behind the web server. AJP Wiki Searchsploit ...

entry.title: TryHackMe Skynet
entry.summary: A vulnerable Terminator themed Linux machine. Nmap Results We Have a few ports open: Port 22 - OpenSSH 7.2p2 Port 80 - Apache httpd 2.4.18 Port 110 - Dovecot pop3d Port 139 - Samba smbd 3.X - 4.X Port 143 - Dovecot imapd Port 445 - Samba smbd 4.3.11-Ubuntu Website Let’s take a look at the website. Running dirsearch we have found a few directories of interest: /admin we don’t...

entry.title: TryHackMe Inclusion
entry.summary: TryHackMe Inclusion This is a beginner level room designed for people who want to get familiar with Local file inclusion vulnerability. Nmap We have only 2 ports open port 22 and port 80 Website Clicking on one of the articles we can see in the URL article?name=lfiattack This is an indication of file inclusion. An attacker can use Local File Inclusion (LFI) to trick the web applicatio...

entry.title: TryHackMe Ignite
entry.summary: TryHackMe - Ignite A new start-up has a few issues with their web server. Nmap results Let’s start off with nmap: nmap -sC -sV -T4 --max-rate 2500 <Box IP> -oN ignite Port 80 seems to be the only port open to us. Website Let’s take a look at the website: Looks like we’ll be dealing with Fuel CMS. If we scroll down a bit, we can see that it gives us a direct link to login t...

entry.title: TryHackMe CMESS
entry.summary: TryHackMe CMesS Can you root this Gila CMS box? The challenge page tells us to add <box IP> cmess.thm to /etc/hosts so let’s do that first. NMAP results Let’s start off by running our nmap scan We can see that there’s 2 ports open port 22 and port 80. port 22 - OpenSSH 7.2p2 port 80 - Apache httpd 2.4.18 Searchsploit looking up Gila CMS on searchsploit we seem to have 2 explo...
